column1: given some width outside off first up and he slashes hard, but can't go past point
gets some drift from around the wicket, going wide of the crease and raps him on the pads on the forward defensive
down the track but doesn't quite get to the pitch of the ball, the bowler perhaps shortened his length, and ends up pushing it back
given some air outside off, tries to drive, but mis-times it
accurate bowling, not giving him too much room or space to play expansive shots and he defends outside off
trickles towards square leg off a thickish inside edged prod, and the first over is a maiden.
good length on the stumps, punched into the offside from close to his body
gets nicely behind this length ball going across him and defends solidly
strays on the pads and is tucked to fine leg to bring up the first runs of the innings
yorker goes wrong, ends up as a low full toss, driven with authority, but mid-on is fairly straight and fields
good length, keeps it on middle and leg, turned to midwicket where there is a largish gap. Square leg runs around to field
not getting the line perfectly right, still on middle and leg and he comes across and turns it into the legside via a thickish inside edge
fuller, draws him forward and he turns it to short fine leg from off stump
slightly shorter and gets it to grip and turn a tad more. He had gone on the back foot to punch, but ends up tamely pushing it to mid-off
flicked to midwicket, it was the arm ball
another arm ball from wide of the crease, flicked to midwicket
defended off the back foot
flatter and quicker on middle and leg, turned to fine leg
fuller outside off, moving away a tad, draws him forward to drive and gets a thick edge to third man
driven firmly to point's left, who dives and fields, ends up parrying the ball towards the other fielders in the circle
that ball seemed to stop on the pitch a little bit and he was early into his drive. Didn't hang in the air too long though, but hit gently enough that point can field
mis-times his drive back past the bowler and mid-off comes around to field
lovely shot. Fuller, going away from him, he leans into the cover drive with exquisite timing
full outside off, he lets it go
he's had enough of Jayasuriya's darts. Comes down the track and lifts him over deep midwicket with ease. Got to the pitch of the ball nicely
another dart fired in quick, he goes back and punches away from his body past the bowler
strays on the pads, he's looking to flick it but misses.
fullish on the stumps, comes on the front foot to work it to short fine leg
goes back this time and taps it through square leg
good length, not quite full enough to drive, makes him stretch out and defend
back of a length outside off, defended back
length outside off, steered to third man
imperious. Full around the fourth stump, goes on the front foot and regally drives this straight back. No chance for bowler or fielders
fuller on off, pushed towards cover. They contemplate a quick single but decide against it
angling into him on a length, cramps him for room and he defends from the crease
good length in the channel and coming into him, tries to tuck it to the leg side but only gets a thin edge that trickles back to the bowler
flat and angling into him, flicked from the back foot through mid-on
good length, drawing him into a lunge to defend
goes well back this time and flicks it off his pads through square leg
good length on the stumps, it's a length he can go deep in his crease to and tuck it backward of square

mis-timed but gets enough on it to run to the long-off boundary. He was backing away even before the bowler was in his delivery stride, and has a good old whack at it. Wanted maximum, but gets four, having cleared the mid-off fielder
good length, stump to stump, flicked through midwicket
Natmeg goes for four. Good ball, yorker swinging into him, he jams his bat down at the last moment and gets enough bat on it to beat short fine leg
length outside off, pushed to point on the front foot
slower ball, floats up well outside off, and he slaps it off the toe end to short cover
that's timed much better. Full and in the slot to drive, he comes on the front foot and executes a pleasing cover drive that bisects the in-field and runs away to the boundary
makes the line a lot closer to the batsman that time, and pulls the length back a tad. Steered to backward point from close to his body
length ball on the stumps, stays still and glides it to third man
back of a length and Zaman was looking to send that up and over with no man back at square leg, but was a bit late on the shot and ends up copping one on the thigh pad
length on the stumps, defended in front of him on the offside. Thinks about a quick single but decides against it
another swing and a miss. Dug this in short, but it flew threw at fair pace to the keeper. Zaman had cleared his front leg and wanted to whack a pull to deep square
good length on leg stump, he tries to flick it off his pads but doesn't time it well and it goes gently to square leg

that leg stump line seems to be troubling Zaman. Perhaps he's not able to adjust to the angle? At any rate, another one that he tries to hit into the legside but doesn't connect with, getting rapped on the thigh pad
fuller outside off, comes on the front foot and drives, but straight to cover
back of a length and well wide of off, but doesn't bounce much. Imam gets low and glides it off the face of a horizontal bat to point
length ball, gets the line closer to the stumps this time and Imam gets behind it and punches back to the bowler
length ball outside off, stays in his crease and nurdles it to third man
full on the fifth stump, he mis-times his drive to mid-off
length outside off, he gets close to it and runs it down to third man
too full on the the stumps, flicked off his toes through midwicket
digs it in short, and Imam goes for the pull but is a tad late on it, and ends up dropping it near him off a bottom edge
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket where the fielder fumbles
back of a length on off stump, and Zaman lets it come to him and runs it down to third man. Stayed very still
back of a length on leg stump, tucked to fine leg
back of a length on the stumps, punched through point, staying beside the ball
bad ball and dealt with appropriately. Short and down leg side, not enough in it to really bounce and he pulls it round the corner from chest height to the fine leg boundary
better line, outside off, he rides the bounce and chops it to cover's right
back of a length on the fourth stump, Imam stays in his crease and keeps bat close to body to run it to third man

inside edge trickles past leg stump. Bangs it in on a hard length and Zaman caught in two minds there, ends up pushing it a little away from his body. Takes  thin edge and rolls past the stumps to the keeper
fullish on off, punched to cover
good, tight bowling to finish after that first ball, not giving any room and keeping it short of a driveable length. Pushed towards point from close to his body
full on the stumps, driven through cover-point off the front foot by opening the face of the bat. Quick running to be alive to the possibility of a second
back of a length, going across him, steered to third man
fuller on the stumps, squirted to third man
length ball on middle and leg, defended back
back of a length on the pads, tucked to fine leg
agricultural heave across the line but lands safely. Went down on one knee to slog, got a top edge but it fell in no man's land behind midwicket
gentle off spin, though not much spin, fullish outside off, steered to short third man
given some air and driven to long-off
complete lack of pace on the ball, a bit shorter, Zaman hangs back and punches past the bowler
fuller, floated outside off stump, pushed back to the bowler
goes a bit flatter that time and is jabbed to long-on from the back foot
fuller outside off, pushed towards mid-off
tossed up on the stumps, driven to long-on
tossed up outside off and he deftly guides it very fine, giving fine leg some work to do
fuller on the stumps, comes on the front foot to work it to short fine. The non-striker was halfway down the pitch and was sent back, the shy misses the stumps

broke in sharply and hit him on the pad. Big shout, not given. Sri Lanka are reviewing. That's a cracking delivery, drifts a tad and spins back, leaving him with bat hanging outside off. He was flummoxed by the turn, and DRS shows three reds, so Imam has to be on his way! Great ball, great decision to review.
fuller on the stumps, comes forward to drive back to the bowler
squirts it off the outside edge to short third man to get off the mark. Turn again for the bowler
length on leg stump, tapped into the leg side
going across him, punched through cover
fuller outside off, driven to long-off
floated up gently, full on the stumps, driven off his toes to long-on's right
complete lack of pace on the ball, and he has to wait for it an age and ends up patting it back to the bowler
outside off, gives himself room and punches forcefully. The bowler mis-fields and lets it through his hands
tossed up outside off and spinning back into him. Lunges out and defends
too much air, ends up a full toss, swept from outside off to deep square leg
corker of a ball! That almost seemed like an edge, but it was just turn and bounce. Fizzes past his forward defensive and takes off too for the keeper to gather
skips down the track but can only push it back to the bowler off the inside half of the bat
stays in his crease and turns it to backward square leg
tossed up on leg stump, turned to short fine leg
short of a length just outside off, punched firmly on the up but can't beat point to the right
short of a length and slanted into the body. Looks to steer it to third man, but it's into the turf and wide slip fields that

wide of mid-on and enough on that despite coming off the inside half. Short of a length just outside off and instead of looking for third man this time, he gets on the front foot and pulls. Only three fielders that side of the ground
length and angled in outside off. Skids on low and past the inside edge as he looks for the late cut
length outside off, leans into the drive to mid-off's right and steals the single
length on leg stump, looks to flick and cops that on the front pad

pumped over the midwicket boundary! Dropped short at a middle stump line, not too much turn on that and he swivels on the back foot to pull in that direction. No fielder in the deep and he doesn't even try to keep that down
length on off stump, driven with the turn, can't beat the bowler's dive to his left
full on leg stump, squeezed into the leg side off the inside edge

wide of mid-off! Good batting from Pakistan. Picking the safe options to take the attack to the most threatening spinner so far. This is full outside off, he gets a big stride out at it and drives aerially and against the turn, but well wide of the fielder
googly at leg stump, turns the face early on this and gets a harmless leading edge into the off side
short of a length on off stump, backs away to make room and runs this to short third man's right to bring up his fifty. Good, positive innings so far
into the mid-riff as he misses on the pull. Just above the box. Short of a length ball on leg stump and he's through the shot too soon
length on off stump, chopped towards point with an open face
length just outside off, opens the face and steers this to point on the front foot
length outside off, looks to drive on the rise. Gets it off the inside half as the bat turns in his hands
length and in at off stump. Dropped into the off side with soft hands
lbw appeal turned down as he looks to go across the line at this
length on middle stump, driven with the angle in to long-on
googly, flat and at a length on leg stump. Flicked behind square and a misfield by short fine leg allows them a second
short of a length on leg stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
full outside off, leans in and drives to sweeper cover

taken at mid-off! Hasaranga gets his revenge! Tosses this one fuller and closer to Fakhar's swing. He hit him wide of mid-off last over when there was more width. This time he's forced to drive from inside the line and he ends up getting it off the low part of the outside half. Bat swivels in his hands and this floats seductively to Udana's right. He follows the path and puts something of a slow-mo dive to grab onto a well-judged catch
googly tossed up at middle stump, gets to the pitch and flicks it down to long-on
length and just outside off, driven on the rise to sweeper cover
length and in at off stump. Defended hurriedly into the covers
length and just outside off, blocked on the front foot
nice line here. Length ball just outside off, solidly blocked on the front foot
length ball just outside off, mistimed drive on the rise trickles into the off side
length and just outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man
full on leg stump, driven to long-on
googly on leg stump, defended down the pitch
length outside off, a legbreak. Solidly blocked on the front foot
short of a length and ripping in at off stump. Backs away and hurriedly chops to backward point
full outside off, leans in and flicks to long-on
full on off stump, driven towards long-off
length just outside off, shuffles and punches to mid-on's left with lovely timing. Sprints for it and slides
slower short ball at off stump, gets nicely behind this and slaps it between fine leg and deep square with a hook. Fine leg puts a lunge to his left and keeps it inside
length and just outside off, defended into the off side
misfield at mid-off. Poor from Sri Lanka's captain. Full and just outside off, a mistimed drive going straight to him and he allows it to sneak through from under him
length outside off, blocked into the covers
length on leg stump, flicked to fine leg with the angle
length on off stump, defended into the leg side on the front foot
tossed up on off stump, can't beat extra cover to his left with the drive
low full toss on leg stump, driven to long-on
googly at a length on leg stump. Defended into the leg side
full googly down leg side. Allows it to come on and tickles it fine
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
short of a length on leg stump, clipped to deep square off the back foot
length on off stump, gets forward and flicks to short fine's left
full on off stump, dropped into the covers with soft hands
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
full on off stump, driven to extra cover on the front foot
length on middle stump, flicked into the leg side with the angle
length and slanted across the corridor. Looks to chop that behind square and is beaten

wow. Pristine from Babar. Length ball just outside off, solid stride out and drilled between stumps and non-striker with the full face offered. Always, ALWAYS corrects himself immediately after being beaten playing angled bat shots. Class player
full and just outside off, sliced to point on the front foot
nicely driven again, but straight to mid-off. Full outside off, driven on the front foot
length on leg stump, shuffles and flicks to fine leg's left with soft hands
expertly chopped to sweeper's left. Offcutter, short of a length outside off and he cuts it late
length on off stump, tapped back down the pitch with the angle
length and into leg stump. Flicked to midwicket
length outside off, leans in and drives to sweeper's left
length and in at leg stump. Flicked to short fine's left
length and in at middle stump. Punched with the angle to long-on
short of a length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
length on off stump, shuffles and flicks to deep square
length and must outside off, defended to midwicket off the inside half
legcutter floated up at a length outside off. Chopped into the vacant gully region with soft hands
thick outside edge as he fails to pick the offcutter. At a length on middle stump, wanted to flick that. It ends up at point after gripping in the wicket
length on off stump, flicked to deep square
yorker at middle stump, jammed into the leg side
length on off stump, defended down the pitch
full on middle stump, flicked to deep square
length on middle stump, steps out and drives down to long-on
length on leg stump, steps out and flicks to short fine's left. He fumbles there and allows a second. It's Thirimanne again with the sloppy fielding
length outside off, pushed down the pitch off the inside half
length on middle stump, punched to midwicket off the back foot
short of a length just outside off, beaten as he looks to run it down to third man
length outside off, punched to sweeper cover on the rise
sliced to deep square's left. Short of a length outside off, looks for the pull but gets underneath that a little bit

that looks close on the lbw. Sri Lanka have reviewed. Full ball in at leg stump and he planted the front leg across the stumps trying to flick this. Hit him on the outside part of the front pad though...umpire's call. Just clipping leg stump. Very close. Looked like that stayed low too. Another good decision from Sri Lanka with the review. They retain this one
short of a length on off stump, flicked to deep square. Looked like a legcutter

a cover drive from the top shelf as Babar brings up yet another ODI fifty. Overpitched ball like a throwdown outside off, and he doesn't miss out on those. Feet, balance, high elbow - all boxes ticked as this races past extra cover
length on off stump, defended to extra cover off the front foot
length on off stump, steps out and drives to long-off
length outside off, leans in and drops into the leg side with soft hands
short of a length on off stump, backs away and punches to sweeper cover
length outside off, steps out and is beaten in flight. Forced to defend into the leg side
short of a length and sliding into the corridor. Miscued pull rolls out to deep midwicket
short of a length just outside off, steers it to third man with an open face
short of a length just outside off, chopped down to third man
parried into the boundary at deep square. Attempted yorker is a leg side full toss. Flicked firmly and Shanaka has to sprint quickly and dive to his right. Too much momentum to stop that cleanly
slower length ball on leg stump, flicked to deep square's right and Shanaka is quick again. Keeps them to one this time
full on middle stump, driven back down the pitch
slower length ball outside off, beaten as he looks to run this down to third man
short of a length outside off, cuts to point with the turn
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
googly at a length on middle stump, steps out and drives to long-on
whipped this over long-on! Babar 2.0. Length and flat and turning away from outside off, but he reaches out and goes against the turn to launch this
length on middle stump, driven down the ground
length outside off, stabbed through the covers on the front foot

and another! Dropped short on middle and off. He jumps deep into the crease and clubs this pull shot over wide long-on. Might have wanted to go more midwicket than long-on, but he's got enough on it to clear the boundary
angling across him, on a length, mis-times his drive to mid-off
back of a length on leg stump, easily turned to deep square leg
nipping in, but wrong line, pitches on middle and is easily picked off the pads, wristily flicked backward of square
not full enough to drive, he tries to ease it through the covers on the front foot but gets it on in the inside half of the bat towards midwicket
straying in line again, on middle and leg, he goes across and picks it off his pads, manoeuvring it through square leg
fullish outside off, runs it to third man off a thick edge
flaoted up wide of off, and he comes forward to drive with an open bat face. another sloppy bit of fielding and they concede the single via a careless overthrow to the keeper's end.
uses his wrists again to steer this between cover and point
stays legside of the ball and drives it square, past a diving point
fuller on the stumps, tapped to long-on from the front foot
drags it down too short and Babar gets down low to pull to deep midwicket from knee height
room outside off and stroked through point, gently but with timing, and placed well enough to get a couple before the sweeper can clean up
tossed up outside off, lunges out to the pitch of the ball and drives through cover
fullish on the stumps, pushed past the bowler
goes on the back foot to one pitched on middle and turning away and cuts forcefully through point.
ooh there's the turn he gets at times. Pitches outside off and breaks sharply, jabs it away
flicked off his pads through square leg
comes forward and drives to long-off
tossed up, almost yorker length, he waits for it and flicks it off his toes to long-on
angled into him from wide of the stumps with his low-arm action, but he manoeuvres it into the offside for a single
fuller, comes on the front foot and turns it, but midwicket is there to cut out thoughts of a single
down the track but the bowler adjusts and bowls shorter and close to him, no room to free his arms, ends up slapping it to long-on with a horizontal bat
fuller, driven to sweeper cover
big stride out to work this around the corner, where short fine leg fields
nice dip and turn on that one, spun away from middle, he had gone deep in his crease and swipes it to long-on
sumptuous Down the track, gets to the pitch of the ball and unleashes a flowing extra cover drive that purrs all the way to the boundary
tossed up on middle, flicked off his toes to deep square leg
another peachy cover drive, this time by the right-hander. Tossed up outside off and he leans into it and finishes with a flourish. There is a man in the deep though, so no boundary
more turn on that one, and he's forced to adjust a bit while whipping this, ends up to the bowler's right
fuller, driven back to the bowler
full on the pads, he moves across and flicks to deep square leg

mix up and Haris Sohail has to go!. This was a length ball outside off, Babar tried to flick, it took an inside edge and flicked his pad and rolled away towards slip. Sohail wanted a single and was charging down the track, Babar was never interested and/or aware of what his partner was doing till he belatedly sent him back. The throw was relayed to the bowler and he took out the stumps from a yard away with Sohail well short
dug it into the pitch and gets it to come back in, jabs it away in defence
good length on a fourth stump line, chops it down to third man
jagged back in sharply and he played all around it, hit on the pads but that was probably going down. Sarfaraz caught on the crease, difficult ball to get first up
another one coming back in, jabbed towards mid-on
tossed up on the stumps, he makes room and plays the inside out drive to wide long-off
tossed up, good length drawing him on the front foot. Sarfaraz taps it into the offside and they take a quick single
drags it down short and Babar absolutely hammers a pull, but straight to midwicket
good length, pitches on off and turning away, he's going across and tries to whip this into the leg side, but can't go very far
tossed up, he takes a step forward and pushes it back to the bowler
fuller on the stumps, opens the face to drive to cover's right. Sloppy by the fielder who could have got there and stopped the ball, but let it go
strays on the pads and he's managed to get a fine tickle on it. Beats the keeper's despairing dive to his left and goes to the boundary

getting some shape is Pradeep but wrong line. Another one that ends up on the pads and he flicks it powerfully but straight to the fine leg fielder. Not happy with that, he though the should have placed it better
cuts back into him and he uses the angle to tuck it backward of square
back of a length outside off, he wanted to punch it forcefully but went too hard at it. Takes the inside half and rolls back to bowler
slower ball, he stays still and drives to long-on, held his shape well
full toss ends up on the pads, flicked to fine leg. Was probably looking for the big swinging yorker
back of a length, keeps it in the channel, Sarfaraz pushes it towards gully and looks for a single but is sent back - rightly so
too full outside off, and he slaps a drive past the short cover fielder
fullish length on the stumps, punched back, but straight and the bowler is able to field on his follow through
slower ball, back of a length going across and Sarfaraz doesn't quite read it, ends up slapping a pull to long-off
back of a length, tight stump to stump line and Babar can only punch it to long-off
cleared his front leg and drives this full, almost yorker length delivery, straight past the bowler. Long-off is fairly straight though so they can only get two
back of a length, nipping in a touch, he plays with bat close to body to punch to cover
full and wide outside off, he sees the opportunity on a loose ball and cuts it hard past point and into the boundary. 11th ODI century for Babar Azam. It's been lovely to watch his batting.
too short and he stays in his crease and disdainfully pulls it  from his waist between deep square leg and fine leg for a boundary
he's getting more expansive now, after the landmark. Full and room outside off, he launches into a cover drive, but there is protection in the deep
fullish length outside off, punched to mid-off from the front foot

Thirimanne scores a direct hit at the non-striker's end from extra cover. Length ball, Sarfaraz had pushed at it but got it a bit high on the bat. Set off for a run, and it needed a direct hit to run him out, which his opposite number nailed.
full on off, driven firmly to long-off's left
angled very far across and ends up outside the tram line, so he'll have to re-bowl that
gets it right this time, nails the wide yorker. Babar tries to steer it away but can't get his bat down in time
slower ball, outside off on a length, he waits for it and cuts it to through cover-point
that sort of slipped out of his hand, but Iftikhar has missed out. Full toss outside off, he tried to power it through cover but didn't connect
slower ball on a length outside off, but expertly played. Waited for it and cut it through backward point late.
goes for the wide yorker but doesn't get it wide enough and the batsman goes down on one knee to carve it to the square third man boundary

that's been smoked over wide long-on. Miss your length on the yorker by inches and you disappear. Stunningly executed, , waited for it and almost helicoptered it over the boundary, using his powerful wrists to get the elevation and distance
walks across and flicks it off his pads to deep square
fuller on off, drilled to long-off

bad ball and sloppy fielding. Down leg side and Babar will feel he's missed out, as it takes the thigh pad and goes under his attempted pull. The keeper does very well to dive to his left and save the ball. But then there is a shy at the bowler's end and the ball ricochets off the stumps

caught at square leg. Not short enough to pull but he has a go at it anyway. The bat turned in his hand and the ball swirled up high. Square leg latched on and held on. That was a tired shot, but he's done his job.
full on off stump, driven to long-off
slower ball, well disguised, the batsman was forced to adjust late and ends up just patting it back to the bowler
full on off, driven powerfully but straight to extra cover
wanted to put the ball out of Iftikhar's reach but ends up bowling it too wide and he'll have to re-bowl that
another full toss missed. Nippy delivery in the channel and he tries to force it through cover but can't connect. Surprised by the full toss perhaps
another slower ball, well disguised again. He had already gone down to sweep and he does that but can't get great timing on it as it rolls to short fine leg
super shot. Low full toss outside off and Imad takes a big stride forward, goes down on one knee and sweeps it square with perfect timing
full on off, slower one again, dug out to extra cover
slower ball outside off, goes for the full-blooded drive, but gets it off the toe-end. Clears mid-off though and falls well short of the man in the deep
slower ball, superbly disguised, length on off stump and the batsman was completely fooled, ended up only defending it
and a yorker now on the middle stump, this is excellent death bowling. He can only dig it out towards long-on

dropped by Udana at long-off. Another slower ball, wide of off stump, and Imad has a thrash at it. Goes off the toe end and Udana needed to be very quick on his feet to come in and catch it diving forward. Ends up not managing to get there as the ball bounces in front of him and goes through for four
follows it with a quicker yorker, which the batsman can only dig back out to the bowler
tries to manufacture something thanks to the excellent bowling by coming down the track and Pradeep bowls a length ball outside off that he bunts to mid-off for a quick single
slower ball, fetches the sweep from well outside off but can't beat square leg
another slower ball, on a length and angling across him this time. He's setting himself up to whack by opening his hips, but has to adjust each time, ends up slapping it gently through cover

the strangulation works. Pakistan weren't getting the ball away, and Imad saw a normal pace delivery and went for it. It was not the easiest to hit, back of a length outside off and his slash ends up as a top edge that loops to deep point, where it's safely held.
finally gets some meat on the ball. Another slower ball, but this one is outside off and he's clearing his leg, waits for it and thrashes it with all brawn over mid-off
full on the pads, goes across and whips to deep square

dropped by Pradeep at short fine leg. Wahab is standing almost square on and Udana bowls it short and on the stumps, he gets inside the line to try and paddle-pull it over short fine, doesn't get hold of it. The ball is not travelling too fast but it's to Pradeep's right. Did he need to dive to get it? Perhaps not, but he does it and it bounces out of his hands
good ball but unfortunate result for the fielding team. Yorker that followed the batsman who was backing away but it flicks the bottom part of the pad and runs down to the fine leg boundary
wham. He was setting himself up for that, clearing his leg and becoming more square on, got it short enough to leather a pull. Not timed so well but hit so hard that it clears deep square leg
full on off, and carved out to long-off
magnificent bowling, pin-point yorker that hits boot and stays near the crease. They get a single with the fielders on the edge of the circle
picked up the slower ball and he deposits it over long-on. Too full and he's got the room to swing his arms freely, having cleared his front leg. Makes good, meaty connection
yorker to finish, but he goes deep in his crease and flicks to deep midwicket. It's only a two, but they try for the third and the throw is accurate so Wahab is run out at the non-striker's end
nicely put away. Overpitched outswinger outside off. Leans into it and opens the face at the end to get this drive wide of mid-off
length ball down leg side, can't connect on the flick
length on middle stump, defended to midwicket's right
length ball shaping slightly away outside off. Left alone
length just outside off, defended to point off the front foot
short of a length and just outside off, pokes away from the body to defend down the pitch
full and into leg stump. Defended to mid-on with the angle
length outside off, pushes in front of the body and into the leg side
length on leg stump, flicked to fine leg's left
full outside off, angled in. Left alone
length and in at leg stump. Pushed to mid-on with the angle

length on off stump, dropped into the off side with soft hands. Extra cover swoops in to his left and flicks with a backhand at the non-striker's end. It dribbles past the fielder backing up and they have an overthrow
clipped aerially to the square leg boundary. Full and into his pads. No need to try and keep that down in the Powerplay. Sends it whistling past square leg
length on middle stump, tucked on the rise to midwicket
length and swinging down leg side, very late. Past the flick
length on off stump, blocked down the pitch on the front foot
full and just outside off. Jammed off the toe-end to cover
134kph, length and swung into the pads. Looks to flick and can't get bat on it
length and angled across off stump. Watchfully defended off the back foot
length outside off, driven on the rise to cover who fumbles as he goes low to his left. Imam there
length outside off, pushed into the off side on the up
length outside off, driven firmly to cover
flies wide of first slip! Full and pushed across off stump. Throws his hands at this and has no control of the shot
beaten. 136kph, short of a length in the corridor. Gets on the front foot and looks to pull across the line. It slides under the bat
length on middle stump, 139kph. Closes the face and nudges this to midwicket

tonks leg stump! Pace has gone up progressively the last three balls. This one is 141kph. It has got the inside edge as he looks to drive this length ball from middle without a big stride. A sweet sound as ball strikes stump. There was a slight movement in, and he just got in a terrible position to drive, with front foot locked across the stumps and the head way in the off side
length on off stump, defended to mid-on on the front foot
length on middle stump, defended to mid-on
outside edge as he's deceived by late awayswing. Full on middle stump and he's looked to hit with the angle like the last two balls. This hoops away though and ends up at third man
length outside off, defended off the back foot
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on middle stump, tapped to mid-on off the back foot
length on off stump, brings down an angled bat on this. Gets a thick inside edge to deep square's left
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length on leg stump. Looks to flick and cops it on the thigh guard
length outside off, opens the face and runs this to point
length on off stump, flicked to mid-on
length on middle stump, defended off the back foot

chipped straight to mid-on! Masterful from Amir. An offcutter, 118kph, floated right up outside off for the cover drive. He takes it on with the drive. His foot has gone nowhere and he's overbalanced into the off side and lifted a friendly one out for Imad
length and pushed across off stump. Left alone
half-hearted drive from Oshada. Full ball outside off, pushes away from the body and checks his drive to get it to mid-off
offcutter at a length outside off, left alone
length outside off, blocked to point on the front foot
full outside off, driven aerially but well short of mid-off
length on off stump, tapped to mid-off on the rise
length on off stump, defended into the covers

chipped to mid-off! Oh boy, this is all too tame from Sri Lanka. Full ball outside off. Wants to drive through the off side but his foot is rooted to the crease. It's there for the drive too, but his lack of movement and his head hanging back make this a lazy shot. And it's come off the toe-end as a result and it's yet another harmless chip
length and in at off stump. Blocked to mid-on from the crease
short ball down leg side. Ducks under it

is there an edge? Yes there is! But they're checking if the ball carried to Sarfaraz. Soft signal is out. Short of a length and slanted in from outside off. Looks to cut well away from his body but that comes in and he gets an under-edge on it...that looks good on carrying through to Sarfaraz. Not even a close call in the end. Captain catches captain, Sri Lanka's score reflects their woeful shot selection this evening
length and slanted in at off stump. Blocked on the front foot
length on leg stump, steps out and jams it back to the bowler
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length and curving in at off stump. Blocked on the front foot
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
short of a length just outside off, chopped straight to short third man
length ball slanted into the pads. Gets deep in the crease and deflects this fine off the front pad
short of a length just outside off, tapped to short point on the rise
inside edge down to fine leg. Wow, interesting shot selection. Short of a length ball outside off and he's had a right heave at this without bothering to get behind the line
length on off stump, defended on the back foot
length on off stump, defended to point
short of a length just outside off. Looks for the cut, mistimes and it trickles into the covers

looks plumb on first look. Oshada has reviewed it. Lenth ball curves in from off stump. He plays the original line outside off and the ball sneaks past the inside edge in the end he's just swishing aimlessly in front of his body. There's no inside edge. And there's no chance. Hits him in front of middle, it's going on to comfortably take leg stump as well. That's the review gone. That's Oshada gone. There's not much that isn't gone at the moment for the visitors
length outside off, pushes on the front foot, gets a thick inside edge past midwicket
length outside off, leans in and pushes to sweeper cover
length outside off, draws him in and rips it past the outside edge as he looks to defend
length on middle stump, clipped to deep square with the angle

overthrows past midwicket. Length ball on off stump, poked into the covers and a wild throw comes in from there to the non-striker's end. It was warranted through. Jayasuirya would have been well short
length on off stump, defended into the leg side off the toe-end
length on off stump, punched on the rise to the bowler
short of a length in the corridor, opens the face and runs this to point
length on leg stump, clipped into the vacant deep midwicket region with the angle
bouncer dug in very short. Ducks under it
length on leg stump, flicked with the angle to fine leg
nicely swept. This is tossed up outside off, he gets low and meets this well in front of the body to get it to the deep backward square boundary
short of a length outside off, left alone
length outside off, flicked to midwicket with the turn
length and curving away outside off, left alone
short of a length on off stump, punched to midwicket off the back foot
length on middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
full on leg stump, gently nudged to mid-on's left on the front foot
tickled fine. Length on leg stump, shuffles to try and flick this. It clips the pad and sneaks through from under Sarfaraz's dive
short of a length in the corridor, left alone
hits him in the rib cage as he looks to duck this short ball. It doesn't bounce as he expects and he gets it on the left side of his chest. He's on his feet, the medical staff will take a look at him
and a sizzling bouncer first up, but an easy one for the batsman to sway away from
back of a length but doesn't rise as much and it's punched confidently to cover, where the fielder has to tumble to his right to stop the ball
walks well across to twirl this length ball outside off to backward square leg
tossed up, looking to drive in the 'V', but gets a thick leading edge that travels through cover
flatter on off, punched to long-on
he's playing for the angle, but Imad is getting to break a tad. Tried to flick off his toes but a leading edge flies up in the air towards long-off. Bounces in no-man's land
comes on the front foot and pushes to cover's right
tucked to deep midwicket by going across
full on the stumps, turned off his toes to deep midwicket, using his wrists
back of a length on the stumps, he stays beside the ball and punches to point
fuller, pushed to mid-off

top edge falls just short of cover. Dug it in short and quick, too pacy for Shanaka, who is in no position to play the pull and is late on it moreover. More than bat hitting ball, that was ball hitting bat, taking the top edge to loop up. Cover swooping in but can't get there
length on the stumps, stays legside of it and pushes it past point

another quick bouncer, but he ducks into it. Pings off his helmet and flies over the slip fielder and into the fence. That a ball banged in short at Wahab's pace keeps as low as that should be worrying for the batsmen
full on off, driven to long-off
tapped to midwicket
turning into the left-hander, who is not reading it. Pitches outside off and he goes to push but it takes a thin edge onto pad
fuller, flicked to midwicket, on the back foot where the fielder does a good job. Shadab Khan it is, who tumbles to his left and saves
pushed gently to long-on
length ball outside off, stroked through cover
walks across to flick this off his hips, but misses it and is struck on the thigh pad. Wahab likes it and appeals, but that might have pitched just outside leg and also been a tad too high
length on off, he stands back and punches on the up past Wahab and very straight
back of a length around the fourth stump, this one also doesn't bounce much, but he stands tall in his crease and punches to mid-off
back of a length but outside off that time and he has the room to cut this to deep point
quick bouncer at 142 clicks, he moves inside the line to hook it, but can't connect. It's past his head by the time he completes the shot
angled across him this time, much fuller and a tad slower, he meets it confidently on the front foot and opens the face to steer it through point
starts with one well wide of off but inside the tram line. Not much turn first up and the batsman lets it go
some turn now, pitches closer to off and breaks away, but short enough for him to get behind the line and punch through cover
very full, and well played by the batsman, who goes down and sweeps this fine, taking it on the full
length on leg stump, worked to deep square leg off the front foot
beauty. Drifts in, pitches on middle nd leg, has the batsman coming down uncertainly for a forward defensive and rips past the bat with turn.
slightly short and he takes toll, going back and cutting it through backward point. in the air for a while but safe shot, well wide of the slip
floated up full and wide, slapped to cover
cover lets it through. Shorter and he stands back and punches from the crease. Cover makes a mess of the fielding effort
fuller, given a mite of air, he comes on the front foot and drives to sweeper cover
some turn for Iftikhar but wrong line, pitches on middle and breaks away down leg
turn again, but too short and wrong line too, easily whipped off his pads to fine leg
'that's a better line' says Sarfaraz from behind the stumps and with good reason. He keeps this on a good length outside off and the batsman can only work it to midwicket
fuller, patted to midwicket
fuller, driven past cover
nice dip on that, drew him on the front foot pressing forward but he didn't quite reach the pitch, and it bounced off his pads
full toss outside off but smashed straight to extra cover
fuller on off, whipped straight, the bowler cops a blow in the midriff while trying to gather
good length, good line, worked off the front foot
a touch too full and driven wide of long-on
length on off, driven to extra cover by opening the face of the bat
flat on off, slapped back but without timing and the bowler goes to his left to field
darted in again, driven back to the bowler
slightly more air on that, patted towards mid-on
darted on off, pushed to extra cover
darting in again, punched from the crease to mid-on. maiden
length outside off, jabs his bat down in defence
tossed up on middle, defended on the front foot towards cover
too full and driven comfortably to long-off
googly, doesn't read it, goes to drive, it rolls to mid-off from the outside half of the bat

huge appeal and that looked close, but maybe it turned too much. Sarfaraz is not interested in the review. Pitched on middle, he was coming on the front foot to drive, bat is nowhere near ball as it spits sharply and hits pad.
turn again, he plays with the angle this time but still pops it in the air. Fortunately for him, no one at square leg
flat outside off, he stays low and cuts it to short third man
flatter again, slightly shorter, he swipes with a horizontal bat but no timing. The bowler fields
fuller on off, driven to extra cover, who makes a mess of it and allows Jayasuriya to finally get a single off Ifthikar
full on the pads, clipped to fine leg on the front foot
fullish outside off, opens the face to steer to short third man
keeping him cramped for room by darting it into him and Jayasuriya just unable to hit the gaps, punches this to midwicket
top spinner skids on, and he stays back and jabs it out into the offside
goes legside of the ball and pushes to cover
clean shot. That was unexpected! Down the track, gets to the pitch and lofts him over long-on with great timing and a perfect arc
turned to square leg
bounced well short of the bowler, but it's a moral win for him. Way too early into the shot, trying to work it off his pads and it pops back towards the bowler
that's been clubbed. Down the track and he just went for power in drilling it straight back. Got enough to send it to the boundary
length outside off, he comes across and gets behind it to defend
too short, spinning onto pad, and is clipped to deep midwicket
flatter outside off, he tries to get low and cut, but only chops it towards point
stands tall and punches it straight but the bowler fields
fuller, goes back and across to tuck this to short fine leg
given more air, he comes forward to work it away but the ball dips early and bounces onto pad. Half-hearted appeal but he was well forward
goes back and whips this off his pads to square leg
that's travelling. Down the track and this is an impressive shot, picks it up and lofts the drive straight and true. Hit so well it flies over the sightscreen!
drags him across by bowling this across him and spins it into him, but he has covered the spin with bat and pad close together, and it takes inside edge onto pad
flicked to square leg
too short and he goes down low to pull this fiercely, but without timing. There is a sweeper back
tossed up to draw him on the front foot, he comes forward and smothers it
short of a length outside off, he wanted to pull that but it goes off the toe end of the bat through midwicket
back of a length, cutting into him, but he plays it well, tucking it backward of square
outside edge goes for four. Got it to straighten a bit and Shanaka was poking at it with feet static, gets an edge that sends it very fine
and that's a much more confident shot, to a bad ball though. Strays on the pads and he goes across to come inside the line and tickle it fine
stunning hit. He was hanging on the back foot, expecting the short ball and Shinwari did just that. Except it didn't really bounce and Shanaka was able to unleash a fearsome pull over midwicket
firm push past the bowler with a straight bat and they steal a quick single
full on middle and leg, gets across and square on, clips it off his toes to midwicket
length on leg stump, turned to square leg using his wrists
length ball on off, defended to cover
back of a length angling into him, pushed towards mid-on
off-cutter, he plays around it and it strikes pads. Comfortably going down though
quick single to mid-on. Risky one, could have been run out if fielder had collected cleanly

given room outside off and he cuts it through point to make me write two sentences I didn't think I would. That's Jayasuriya's half-century. That's also the 100-run partnership! Good effort by Imad who ran and dived at the point boundary to keep the ball inside
length ball deflected to third man
short of a length on off, he stands tall and pulls, but gets it higher on the bat and it rolls to mid-on
length ball on leg stump, clipped off the thigh pad to deep square leg
defended back
back of a length outside off, he has a big heave-ho at it, but doesn't connect cleanly. In the air for a bit but lands well in front of mid-on
attempted yorker, ends up as low full toss, he manages to flick to midwicket while off balance
back of a length, moving across him, stays in his crease and defends
yorker whistles past the off stump and through the batsman. Pitched outside off and went straight, beaten completely
fullish, clipped to square leg
top edge falls safe. Has a swipe at this one, gets it off the toe end and it flies straight over, but lands behind mid-off
another yorker outside off, he wanted to steer it to third man but it takes the inside edge to square leg
length on off, he gets behind it and defends it towards square leg
back of a length on leg stump, tries to pull it, gets it fine enough to pick up two
fullish on the stumps, wristed to deep square leg
length on the stumps, turned to midwicket
length ball on the stumps, walks across to swivel it down to fine leg
back of a length on off, moves across and taps it to midwicket
short ball up at the front shoulder. Swishes from under it and is beaten
slower ball at a length on leg stump, flicked straight to short fine
short of a length on off stump, dropped into the off side with soft hands
swatted away! Length outside off, keeps the front foot clear of the line and clubs it over midwicket
yorker length and just outside off. Gets low and jams it down to third man
slower ball at a length on middle stump. Defended into the leg side on the front foot
short ball tucking him up at the ribs as he shapes to pull. Ends up dragging it to fine leg's right and now he's on the floor. Looks like cramp. They won't get a run
bouncer at off stump, ducks under it
short of a length on off stump. Stays behind the line and opens the face to run this to third man's left. Comes back for a quick second, so those legs are much better now
short of a length on leg stump, whipped out to deep square
short of a length and tucking him up as he backs into the leg side to try and flick. Can't get it further than pitchside
slow full toss outside off as he backs away. Throws his arms at it and gets a thick outside edge to third man
length and angled in at off stump. Blocked into the off side
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
full outside off, sliced to extra cover from deep in the crease
tossed up full and wide outside off. Driven straight to extra cover
length at off stump, steps our and drives it to long-off

fifty! He's been fluent today and he gets it with a fluent shot too. Short of a length delivery angled in to him and he waits the perfect amount before going back and chopping this between backward point and short third man
short of a length slider across the corridor. Waits on it to arrive and jabs it late to short third man's left
doesn't gather this. Short ball turning away outside off. Beaten on the pull
short of a length and down leg side. Lets that go
length on leg stump, steps out and hoicks at this. Thick inside edge to deep square's right

just clears a lazy effort at short third man and trickles into the boundary. Mohammed Amir with hardly an effort there. Length ball outside off. Looks for the reverse sweep, ends up top edging it. Amir just static, not even taking steps backwards or attempting to chase after this as he jumps for it
short at leg stump, top-edged pull out to deep backward square
short of a length slider outside off, mistimed pull to midwicket
drilled over the bowler. Length ball outside off from around the wicket. Steps out and uses the pace on it to swing from under it. Imad with evasive action because that was firmly struck
short of a length on middle stump, shuffles and miscues a pull to deep midwicket
oh stylishly done! Just like that, they have nine off the over. Length ball slanted into him. Uses the angle and flicks aerially to the midwicket boundary. No one is there
short of a length outside off, chopped to sweeper cover
length outside off, looks for the reverse paddle, gets it to point off the cue end
length on leg stump, whipped out to deep backward square
length on leg stump, looks to flick. Big lbw appeal is turned down. That was spinning down leg
missed stumping! Also a dropped catch, apparently. Length ball pushed through flat outside off. He steps out and has a hack at it. Gets an edge that sneaks through Sarfraz's grasp
length on middle stump and turning down. He shuffles and flicks it deftly past short fine. Usman gives chase and a big slide, but he can't stop that
length on middle stump, gets deep and flicks to short fine's right
length outside off, leans in to defend and is beaten on the outside edge

crunched over the bowler! That's a gutsy shot with long-off back, but he's hit this well to his right. Full and flat ball outside off, gets to the pitch ad nails the connection. A few bounces and this is four
short of a length just outside off, opens the face and runs it to third man
length and in at off stump, shuffles and flicks to deep square
short of a length and in at off stump. Uses the angle and turns it to deep square
offcutter at a length, wide outside off. Slides through at shin height as he looks to slog this
short and into the body. Dragged out to deep square off the back foot
yorker in the corridor. Jams it down to third man
short outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man
fizzes past the edge. Short of a length and following him down leg side. He looks to chop it down to third man
length on middle stump, watchfully dropped into the leg side from deep in the crease
nicely bowled. A mean bouncer, up at the front shoulder. He's forced to drop his bat to let that go
short and up in the corridor. Gets above it and steers it down to third man
tumbling stop at fine leg from Amir. Slower ball is dropped short and he gets down and ramps it. Amir sprints to his right and keeps this to one
mistimed slog but floats safely into the vacant midwicket area. He's getting it to slide in from a length, around the wicket
length and into leg stump. Hurriedly flicked into the leg side
well bowled. Slower ball at a length on off stump, from around the wicket. Shapes for the flick but is forced to defend this
length outside off, shuffles and mistimes another slog. Really slamming that ball into the pitch. It's coming off the high part of the bat

got him? Yes! A faint edge! It's not to be for Shehan Jayasuriya. He's looking at the heavens in despair. What a knock. Just not enough to best Pakistan's best bowler on the night. Length all angled into the corridor. Opens the face and wants to run this down to third man but gets a faint edge that carries to the keeper. A standing ovation as he goes off. He's doubled his ODI tally today with his first fifty. Won't forget this for a long time
length ball fired in at off stump. Hurriedly defended into the off side

finds deep midwicket! In three balls, a potential miracle has been seriously dented. That's a terrible delivery if you ask anyone, including the bowler himself. Very short on off stump. Backs away and looks to pull this over the midwicket boundary. It comes off the toe-end and Fakhar runs in, lunges and slides with grace as he holds on to this. Shanaka kept the scoring rate ticking early on and barely did anything wrong this evening. But he won't be there at the end for Sri Lanka either
misses out on yet another terrible short ball! Is it the dew? Shadab drops this halfway down the pitch. It sits up in the corridor but he misses on the slog
length on off stump, stabbed into the covers
full outside off, driven straight to extra cover
short of a length outside off. Backs away and hurriedly cuts to backward point
tossed up outside off, driven to sweeper cover
length and in at off stump. Defended into the covers
bouncer down leg side, ducks under it
just lifted over mid-on with an attempted slog. Comes off the toe-end. Short of a length outside off
length and in at leg stump, flicked to mid-on's right
length and in at the stumps. Gets the front leg out of the way and slogs. Gets an inside edge onto pad
five-for! His second five-wicket haul in ODIs. Lobs up a slower ball outside off, on a good length. He backs away and swings for it. Gets an outside edge that balloons up for the keeper
narrowly past off stump. Kumara in no mood to take this deep, and fair enough too. Length ball slanted in and narrowly past the stumps as he looks for the slog first up
length at the stumps, stabbed into the off side
nicely ramped away, but only one at third man. Short ball in the corridor, just uses the angle to get it down there
full and tailing into the corridor. Looks to swish this through the off side, beaten
low full toss on middle stump. Attempted yorker, no doubt. Defended to mid-on
misses off stump again. Yorker tailing inwards again, but not enough as Kumara exposes the stumps and looks to squeeze this into the off side
slower ball at a length on off stump. Blocked into the off side

oh boy get out of here! Shot of the day! Length ball pushed up at off stump. He steps out, gets to the pitch, and launches a fellow legspinner handsomely over extra cover for six. Stunning, stunning shot.
sliced up into the vacan extra cover region. Doesn't get to the pitch this time, just swings from the crease. Survives though
another stylish hit! Length on off stump, steps out and creams this straight over the bowler to clear the boundary
length and dipping outside off, shuffles and looks for the sweep. Beaten
length and turning away from a length again. Sweeps and is beaten again
and beaten again. Three superb deliveries from Shadab keep him at 9-0-70-1. Length ball, dipping, drifting, ripping away. He had no chance as he looked to drive that
attempted yorker, tickled into the midwicket region off the toe-end
knee high full toss steered straight to point! A big smile from the batsman. A few feet either side, that would have flown to the point boundary

wow! What is with this guy and hitting over extra cover? Some stunning inside-out hits. This one is a slower ball at a length outside off. He waits on it, plants half a stride out and slaps this over the infielder
length on off stump, backs away and chops it to third man
short of a length just outside off and left alone. So they have a plan

and he's bluffed him comprehensively! Oh Wahab, why'd you do that to the poor No. 10. Bowls it short of a length. Kumara is fending for a bouncer because of that field change. He's trapped right in front of the stumps, on the knee flap, as this slides on from the surface. They don't have any reviews left, but Kumara doesn't look too livid about this so we could assume there's no bat on it
length outside off steps out and drives to deep extra cover's left
dipping length ball outside off, beaten on the attempted ramp past third man
sliced over cover. Dipping length ball outside off, steps out and miscues the inside-out drive this time
short ball outside off, shuffles and pulls to deep square's left

taken at deep midwicket. And that is the end. Full ball outside off, there for one of his favoured inside-out lofted drives, but he chooses to go slog sweep. He's got no room to execute it after shuffling into the off side. Ends up slicing it for Ifthikar who runs in some ten yards and holds on easily
